abstract: Chicago Tribune's request to the University of Illinois of the release of a list of well-connected parents whose children got an edge in admissions has set off a legal battle that pits the state's freedom of information law against the federal privacy law for educational records.
snippet: The University of Illinois is fighting a newspaper request to release the list of well-connected parents whose children got an edge in admissions.
lead_paragraph: The University of Illinois is fighting a newspaper request to release the list of well-connected parents whose children got an edge in admissions.

headline.main: Privacy and Press Freedom Collide in University Case
headline.print_headline: Privacy and Press Freedom Collide in University Case
headline.seo: University of Illinois Case: Privacy vs. Press Freedom
